level.heading: CONCESSION STANDS[COLON] PERMITS TO ERECT STANDS (ยง 24-826)

level.text: Permits to erect concession stands on public space within the jurisdiction of the Mayor, shall be obtained from the Director of Consumer and Regulatory Affairs.

Applications for a permit shall be accompanied by at least two (2) blueprints or linen tracings showing structural details of the stand, including all wiring and piping, and the location of the stand.
Applications shall be filed not later than five (5) days prior to Inauguration Day.

Permits for electrical wiring or appliances shall be obtained from the Director of Consumer and Regulatory Affairs, subject to the requirements of the D.C. Electrical Code (DCMR Title 13), and approval of the Director of Housing and Community Development.

Applications for electrical permits shall be filed no later than five (5) days prior to Inauguration Day, and shall be accompanied by the appropriate fees, payable to the D.C. Treasurer, as set forth in the electrical fee schedule (D.C. Code ยง47-2712).

level.heading: SOURCE
level.text: Sections 20(b) & (c) of the Presidential Inauguration Special Regulations and Rule of Interpretation Concerning Nonrevival of Statutes Act of 1982, D.C. Law 4-125, 29 DCR 2093 (May 21, 1982).
